body: LGTM. Leave @ewencp to determine whether we remove the local publishing command.
Changed `install` to `installAll`
Yup, this makes sense. LGTM too.
Great, LGTM too. Thanks @ijuma!
@ijuma LGTM. Does this need to be double committed to 0.9.0 too?
Yes, please. I will then do a PR for kafka-site that includes all doc changes to the 0.9.0 branch since the last update.
@granders @ijuma mind taking a look?
@guozhangwang Thanks.
Thanks for the PR. Could you please add a test too?
Thanks for the PR. Instead of sorting on every log statement, another approach is to sort it once and pass the sorted seq around. Have you considered this approach?

one overall general comment on the implementation is that the brokers properties themselves could cary this information making it so the topic creator doesn't have to know this. the fact is that still a lot of humans run the topic command but in many cases it is some software system operationally doing it. in either case if the broker had a property rack=0 or whatever it could then just be the way you have the topic distribute that information it should already be able to gather. Granted, this implementation saves a lot of having to store it in zookeeper so rationally speaking this is better than putting any code in to that. 

Sorry if I missed the entire discussion thread on this just seeing it for first time. I like it, would love to see this get into trunk and start to be used and also in the next release. 

Nice work so far!!!
@fpj Looks simple enough, just one question about tests to validate the new behavior.

@granthenke Minor questions/nits. Other overarching question is about using this across multiple CLI tools. I can't think of anywhere else we've done something similar, but have you done a quick scan through? It'd be good to have a couple more people agree that this is a good path to go down wrt allowing certain commands to be strict/loose in their operation -- seems like the kind of options we might want to add to `ConsumerGroupCommand`, `AclCommand`, `ConfigCommand`, etc.

Please see KIP-36 for the latest proposal. (https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-36+Rack+aware+replica+assignment)

The biggest difference is that the rack information is added as a broker meta data in ZooKeeper. Consequently the inter-broker (UpdateMetadataRequest) and client to broker meta data query protocol (TopicMetadataResponse) will be changed to have rack information. 

Once the KIP is accepted, I will update this PR to incorporate these new ideas.

@ijuma The patch looked fine, but I'm seeing some failures that happen repeatedly:

```
kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest > testCleanLeaderElectionDisabledByTopicOverride FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: Timing out after 5000 ms since leader is not elected or changed for partition [topic-3286870284180053297,0]
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.fail(TestUtils.scala:713)
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$$anonfun$waitUntilLeaderIsElectedOrChanged$8.apply(TestUtils.scala:706)
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$$anonfun$waitUntilLeaderIsElectedOrChanged$8.apply(TestUtils.scala:706)
        at scala.Option.getOrElse(Option.scala:120)
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.waitUntilLeaderIsElectedOrChanged(TestUtils.scala:705)
        at kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest.verifyUncleanLeaderElectionDisabled(UncleanLeaderElectionTest.scala:229)
        at kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest.testCleanLeaderElectionDisabledByTopicOverride(UncleanLeaderElectionTest.scala:155)

kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest > testUncleanLeaderElectionDisabled FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: Timing out after 5000 ms since leader is not elected or changed for partition [topic2014117567975291008,0]
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.fail(TestUtils.scala:713)
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$$anonfun$waitUntilLeaderIsElectedOrChanged$8.apply(TestUtils.scala:706)
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$$anonfun$waitUntilLeaderIsElectedOrChanged$8.apply(TestUtils.scala:706)
        at scala.Option.getOrElse(Option.scala:120)
        at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.waitUntilLeaderIsElectedOrChanged(TestUtils.scala:705)
        at kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest.verifyUncleanLeaderElectionDisabled(UncleanLeaderElectionTest.scala:229)
        at kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest.testUncleanLeaderElectionDisabled(UncleanLeaderElectionTest.scala:123)
```

Also, not critical here and I understand why this is marked as `MINOR`, but we might want to come up w/ some sort of heuristic for when to use that to avoid JIRAs. While the key change is small and all changes are in tests, the patch ends up being non-trivial, yet mostly mechanical. It's bigger than I would (personally) normally consider minor.
LGTM, thanks!
Test added.  Let me know if you want any additional tests.

@ewencp Thanks for the review. Yes, fixing the bug uncovered a test that should have been failing, but was not. I'm investigating. I should have mentioned it here, sorry.

Good point with regards to minor. Depending on the outcome of the investigation I was planning to possibly create a JIRA. In our contribution guidelines, we state that a JIRA is not needed if what should change is the same as the how it should change, but we can tweak that if we feel differently. Another criteria that I use is if it's something we'd want to be in the release notes. In any case maybe the prefix MINOR is a bit misleading as well.
LGTM (assuming that tests pass).

LGTM

@junrao maybe you can review this when you have a chance.
RequestTime maybe not very long and integer is enough

@ewencp I have not checked other scripts, the main reason I want to add these options here are a result of [KAFKA-2198](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2198). Now that the script returns error codes. Automated scripts that worked before, fail when the topic does not exist. The if-exists/if-not-exists options provide a safe way to resolve that. I agree it could be useful in other places and others agreement on the pattern would be good.
LGTM
@granthenke Makes sense. LGTM. Thanks!

@ijuma Ah, makes sense. Didn't quite get that it was WIP.

Re: minor, also makes sense. I think I just have this reaction when I see "MINOR" and then it takes more than a minute to scan through the patch :)
@ewencp @ijuma Any chance you could take a look?

@granthenke Actually, it's a long everywhere it is passed to another method. That's because timeouts are usually `long` in APIs. In practice we can use `int`s for all the timeout options since they all should have a non-infinite value and any reasonable value fits into an `int`.
LGTM.
LGTM
@guozhangwang Would you have time to review this patch?

This patch does the following:
- Do clean shutdown in VerifiableProducer.stop_node()
- Only check whether producer/consumer is alive if the number of messages is infinite. If producer is configured to send finite number of messages, it is OK for producer/consumer to have stopped at the time stop_producer_and_consumer() is called.
@granders Can you review this patch?
Thanks for the patch. LGTM.
Thanks for the patch. Yes, I agree with @ijuma . It seems it's simpler to just sort the broker ids once in BrokerChangeListener and pass them as Seq as they are now.
@shtratos I think the example still needs fixed in trunk, but the code has diverged. Can you rebase?
LGTM. Merged to trunk.

@lindong28 A few comments, but looks straightforward. Did you fire off a full test run? `ProduceConsumeValidateTest` is used by ~ half a dozen test classes, so it'd be good to verify they all still pass cleanly.
LGTM.

LGTM. I know you filed the ducktape test as a separate subtask, but in the future if you want to roll the system test update into the same patch, it's actually easier to review together for relatively small patches like this since the system test itself is the best validation of the original patch.
@ewencp Thanks for your review. I have fixed issues and used 60 seconds timeout for join. I will run all tests overnight.

Users can use pass a custom `message.handler` class that could be affected by this change. Are we OK with removing without a deprecation period? Thoughts @junrao?

Also, if we do remove it, we should add a note to the upgrade notes for the next release as part of this PR.
Great, LGTM. Thanks @fpj!
@ewencp do you mind taking a look at this, it has been pending for quite some time now. Thanks!

We ran into this issue today. We were doing a rolling upgrade of existing brokers, when one of our services that's a producer was rolled out as well. This prevented our producer service from starting up when the rest of the brokers were fine. It would be nice to have this patch put into both 0.8.2.x and 0.9.x.

Review by @ewencp or @guozhangwang (both of you showed interest in this problem).

I've included a few clean-ups in this PR, let me know if you'd prefer if I submitted them separately.

The custom handler does not exist in 0.8.2, so this will only affect users who implemented it on 0.9.0.

I would prefer to remove it now (with an upgrade note). Those who use it will understand, since they must have noticed this method is never called.
Sounds good.
LGTM
@apovzner It would be nice if you can add some background information for this PR (or the following PR). It would definitely give people some context on why we need this.
ping @ymatsuda for reviews.
@lindong28 One more minor fix, but looks good. Let me know if there's a link for the full test run (or just that you've verified they pass).
@ewencp Thanks for the helpful comment. I have updated the patch. I ran the test yesterday night but there was a bunch of failure.. I am going to run tests twice, with and without the patch, tonight.
I added an upgrade note. Is it ok or should I reformulate it?
@Mszak, that list is for 0.9.0.0, I think you want to add this one under 0.9.0.1.
Or alternatively maybe just mention in the note that it applies to 0.9.0.1 and later.
Review by @guozhangwang
Replaced by https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/765

@enothereska, awesome to start using the ZK async APIs!

Having spent some time on the controller code recently, it is quite complex (and there are a few bugs reported against it) so I think we need to be careful about our strategy for moving from sync to async APIs while not making things even more complex. Do you have any thoughts on this?

@ewencp Agreed, it seems OK. A few suggestions from me:
- Introduce a base class with shared methods for checking serializability compatibility (the two tests seem to have quite a bit of duplicated code)
- Introduce a folder under resources to group serialized data (`serialized-data` perhaps). I wondered if we should also include some kind of versioning, but it seems like we can do that when/if the need arises.
- Name each serialized file with the name of the class being serialized instead of an abbreviation.

@ijuma : agree on complexity. The ZK async API does not radically change the code, it merely shuffles some of the code that existed after a sync call to a callback. Also currently this only touches only the failover case. I've tested with the system tests using ducktape and tests/kafkatest/test/replication_test.py and they pass. I've also checked in a unit test. I do think there is a need for more controller tests in general.
@enothereska and did you remove the sync version (so that we don't have the same logic in two places)?
@ijuma : the sync version is still there since non-failure paths still use that.
@enothereska I see. That leaves me a bit uneasy unless we have a clear plan in terms of removing the duplication.

LGTM overall. Personally I feel this additional logic in "selectLeader" does make sense, since in general we may not be able to trigger the last "remove replica" event when the failed replica is the controller itself, and hence from the view of the new controller the old replica leader was never failed but just no longer in the aliveBroker list any more.

So before we abort the leader election process due to either error or configured mechanism (e.g. unclean leader election not allowed), we may need to update the corresponding "source-of-truth" to reflect the abortion, that the new leader was not successfully elected, and hence the partition should be "offline".

An alternative way to do this, is when new controller is elected (in `ControllerFailover`), let it to browse through the ZK's stored leaderAndISRs and check if any of the brokers are no longer in the aliveBroker list, and if any trigger `onBrokerFailured` on each one of them. This may also be as efficient since we are already reading all the topics' replica assignment anyways in `ControllerFailover`.
Addressed your comment @guozhangwang and thanks for the review. It may be worth getting @junrao's opinion as well on which of the two approaches we should go for.

@enothereska @fpj What are your thoughts on wrapping the callbacks into a Future-based API (a bit like https://github.com/bigtoast/async-zookeeper-client)? IMO, that would make the code more readable and make it easy to have a single async method (for the sync case one just waits for the future to complete within a certain amount of time).
VerifiableProducer is not properly terminated after the patch for some tests.. I am trying to understand why this happened.
@ewencp It seems that, if kafka is bounced, then verifiableProducer can not be shutdown via SIGTERM. I do more investigation and get back to you later.

@ewencp, @Ishiihara: Note that I've removed the synchronized blocks in WorkerSinkTask since it seems the methods are only called from within the WorkerSinkTaskThread. I'm happy to revert this change and open a separate ticket if you prefer.
@ymatsuda Addressed comments.

@hachikuji The exception handling make sense. It would be nice if we can add a simple unit test to make sure the exception is caught properly to ease future development. 
@ewencp I think removing the synchronization code makes sense but I do feel a bit wired with the current threading. It seems that the main thread doesn't do much other than starting the work thread. If performing the work in another thread is not necessary, should we simply it to only use one thread?
@ijuma I addressed your review. Thanks for the feedback.
@ijuma @ewencp Any feedback on this patch? Its related to our dev list discussions [here](http://search-hadoop.com/m/uyzND1LHQWW23C0j&subj=Consider+increasing+the+default+reserved+broker+max+id).
@Ishiihara It's kind of nasty with all the mocking, but I've added a couple test cases.
LGTM

Started the system test branch builder:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_system_tests_branch_builder/337/
@hachikuji Verified the unit tests. LGTM in general. I would like to hear comment from @ewencp on the synchronization and threading.

@Ishiihara Sounds good. I'm just getting started with this code, but the current threading model seems reasonable to me. I see the Worker as just the task manager, which is primarily responsible for managing the task lifecycle. Currently this just means starting and stopping tasks, but it'll probably have to be extended to handle task failures. I assume it'll also need hooks for status tracking. Also, I like the tasks being single-threaded since it makes it easy to reason about their state.
LGTM

Looks like this shows up in configuration.html too. 
Could you put "MINOR:" at the start of the pull request title too?

@s7anley A good point. Thanks for the reference. LGTM
@ymatsuda Also add the Getter support for KTableAggregate.
LGTM. Jenkins failures are not related.
Jenkins failure seems not relevant.
LGTM. It fixes the JIRA bug I opened (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3091). Thanks.
Merged to trunk.
@mpoindexter Sorry this sat for so long without comment. It needs updates to bring it up to date with trunk, but if we get an updated patch I'd be happy to review, test, and merge.
@granthenke I have rebased the PR and addressed your points.
@gwenshap @ewencp @junrao Could one of you take a look? @granthenke and @ijuma have reviewed.

@granders Tracked this down to 9220df9f8b58870a2282d3e4ceb2e003667d854b. Verified this fixes the failing test and still passes all of security_rolling_upgrade_test. Maybe @benstopford can sanity check this as well since he was the author on the original patch?

And perhaps @gwenshap for final review + commit?
Review by @ewencp please.
Thanks for fixing this @ewencp, makes sense to me.
@junrao I have updated the PR based on your comments. Could you take a look when you have time?
